item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, May 26, 2025 at 1:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Podman Desktop a 100% free OSS alternative to Docker Desktop (11 points | 1 comment)
2. Particle Life simulation in browser using WebGPU (23 points | 11 comments)
3. The double standard of webhook security and API security (23 points | 1 comment)
4. Show HN: A minimalist web timer for focus and time tracking (40 points | 16 comments)
5. Jjui – A Nice TUI for Jujutsu (129 points | 26 comments)
6. Ten years of JSON Web Token and preparing for the future (204 points | 103 comments)
7. Open Source Society University – Path to a free self-taught education in CS (415 points | 129 comments)
8. GitHub issues is almost the best notebook in the world (113 points | 59 comments)
9. Bagel: Open-source unified multimodal model (146 points | 22 comments)
10. Violating memory safety with Haskell's value restriction (36 points | 4 comments)
11. Venta AI (YC S23) Is Hiring a Founding Full Stack Engineer in Amsterdam ( | hide)
12. At Amazon, some coders say their jobs have begun to resemble warehouse work (455 points | 645 comments)
13. Google shared my phone number (419 points | 141 comments)
14. Ask HN: What are you working on? (May 2025) (249 points | 772 comments)
15. Lottie is an open format for animated vector graphics (328 points | 155 comments)

18. Plwm – An X11 window manager written in Prolog (203 points | 55 comments)

20. Writing your own CUPS printer driver in 100 lines of Python (2018) (187 points | 27 comments)
21. Whippet GC notes on Guile, heuristics, and heap growth (65 points | discuss)
22. Lieferando.de has captured 5.7% of restaurant related domain names (255 points | 141 comments)
23. Trading with Claude, and writing your own MCP server (141 points | 58 comments)
24. 'Strange metals' point to a whole new way to understand electricity (18 points | 2 comments)
25. CAPTCHAs are over (in ticketing) (184 points | 229 comments)
26. New method for creating large 3D models of urban areas is faster and cheaper (46 points | 3 comments)
27. Design Pressure: The Invisible Hand That Shapes Your Code (191 points | 53 comments)
28. Ask HN: Anyone struggling to get value out of coding LLMs? (102 points | 90 comments)
29. Lisping at JPL (2002) (151 points | 58 comments)
30. Tariffs in American History (145 points | 205 comments)
